comments:
Error occured with big project. With small projects all is ok.

May be it all about manually writed configuration file, since there is no 
ability to add J2EE features to existing Java project.

In attaches - log, config files for project.

Created an attachment (id=23496)
Log from eclipse

Created an attachment (id=23499)
Eclipse Configuration

I'm running 3.1 RC2 version of Ecplise with latest integration build of WTP
I20040617

at morning, after some experiments with project classpath (adding "con" 
entries), log became shorter:


!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.runtime 4 2 2005-06-18 13:26:56.55
!MESSAGE An internal error occurred during: "Publishing to Tomcat v5.5 Server @ 
localhost...".
!STACK 0
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:91)

May be I found a solution.

After trying to add new project to server publish list, in server.xml added 
lines:

<Context docBase="E:\Projects\Programming\Java\arp.site\.deployables\ArpSite" 
path="/" reloadable="true" source="com.ibm.wtp.web.server:ArpSite" />

ArpSite - it is the constant from .wtpmodules, and arp.site - it the name of 
project.

If I replace com.ibm.wtp.web.server:ArpSite with 
com.ibm.wtp.web.server:arp.site, all is ok:

<Context docBase="E:\Projects\Programming\Java\arp.site\.deployables\ArpSite" 
path="/" reloadable="true" source="com.ibm.wtp.web.server:arp.site" />

Now server started normally!

The StackOverflowError is from JDT and is unrelated to this problem. You should
open a separate bug against the Eclipse platform for this. The log is also
filled with several other issues that appeared over a couple days of use and are
unrelated.

The problem here appears to be that the module id is different from the
directory that the module is being published to, and that the module factory
does not recognize the same id that it initially returned a module with. I have
tried several different ways, but I am unable to reproduce either behaviour in a
recent build.

J2EE team - Are there any circumstances that a flexible module would have a
.deployables directory that doesn't match its name, or an id that doesn't match
its name? Things look ok for both, and everything appears to be working when I
tested - if you've made any fixes in this area recently then this bug might have
already been fixed.
Can't reproduce this on a recent build

This bug was moved to 'closed' state, since it is so old is is assumed its dup, invalid, or worksforme resolution is no longer in qustion and the bugzilla needs no further attention. Feel free to re-open, or open a new bug, if this semi-automatic processing was done in error in this case.
